result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory J. Sawka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>50g) 2nd+ [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 12/18/2015 per Order at hearing on sentence credit.  
Sentence credit of 262 days removed and substracted from initial confinement term.
Consecutive to: Burnett County Case 10CF84

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with J.D. or V.K.  Not to use, consume or possess any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Any assessments or conditions per agent.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: Burnett County Case 10CF84

records.addlTxt:
Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.
Proposed Order - Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP
